characters.alibi: Claims to have been at a gallery opening with Charlotte. The owner of the gallery confirms they were there, but cannot confirm the exact times.
characters.description: Arthur, a renowned art critic, known for his sharp wit and even sharper tongue. He's dressed impeccably, as always, with a silk scarf draped around his neck.
characters.name: Arthur Perry
characters.personality: Arrogant, critical, but deeply insecure behind the facade.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been working late in her studio, but has no witnesses.
characters.description: Charlotte, a rising star in the art world, known for her abstract sculptures. She's wearing paint-splattered overalls and has a determined glint in her eyes.
characters.name: Charlotte Reed
characters.personality: Ambitious, fiercely independent, with a hidden vulnerability.

characters.alibi: Admits to being at the victim's house but claims he left hours before the murder.
characters.description: David, the victim's disgruntled business partner, looks nervous and avoids eye contact. His clothes are rumpled, and he keeps fidgeting with his hands.
characters.name: David Miller
characters.personality: Anxious, resentful, feels overshadowed by the victim's success.

characters.alibi: Was at the local bar, The Drunken Palette, all evening. Several patrons corroborate this.
characters.description: Emily, a struggling artist and close friend of the victim, is visibly distraught. She's dressed simply and her eyes are red from crying.
characters.name: Emily Carter
characters.personality: Kind, loyal, but deeply insecure about her own artistic talent.

characters.alibi: Confirms Emily was at the bar all evening.
characters.description: Tom, the bartender at The Drunken Palette, is wiping down the counter with a practiced hand. He seems unfazed by the events.
characters.name: Tom Baker

characters.description: John, the victim, was a wealthy art collector and gallery owner, known for his impeccable taste and ruthless business sense. He was found dead in his study.
characters.name: John Smith
characters.personality: Ambitious, ruthless, with a keen eye for talent and a love of luxury.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been home all night. Her husband confirms this.
characters.description: Sarah, John's wife, is a socialite and philanthropist. She's dressed in elegant mourning clothes and appears genuinely grief-stricken.
characters.name: Sarah Smith
characters.personality: Elegant, composed, but perhaps hiding something beneath the surface.

characters.alibi: Confirms Sarah was at home. He was also at home all night.
characters.description: Robert, Sarah's husband and John's best friend. An accountant in his late 40's, his appearance is plain.
characters.name: Robert Jones
characters.personality: Meek, quiet, a bit of a pushover.

characters.alibi: Claims to have been at an auction. He has been confirmed as there by CCTV.
characters.description: Michael, John’s lawyer and executor of the will. Always wears a suit and looks stern, the consummate professional.
characters.name: Michael Hudson

clues.description: A crumpled piece of paper with angry scribbles: 'I'll make you pay for stealing my ideas!' It seems to be addressed to the victim.
clues.name: Notebook Page

clues.description: Arthur claims he was at a gallery opening the evening of the murder and hated the victim for taking his ideas.
clues.name: Arthur's Testimony

clues.description: A receipt from 'Art Supplies R Us', showing a large purchase of paints and sculpting materials.
clues.name: Charlotte's Receipt

clues.description: Charlotte claims she was working late in her studio the evening of the murder.
clues.name: Charlotte's Testimony

clues.description: A business agreement showing that David was recently cut out of a lucrative deal with John Smith.
clues.name: Business Agreement

clues.description: David claims he left John's house hours before the murder and strongly denies any wrong doing.
clues.name: David's Testimony

clues.description: Emily claims she saw John arguing with David earlier that day.
clues.name: Emily's Testimony

clues.description: Tom claims Emily was at the bar all evening looking distraught.
clues.name: Tom's Testimony

clues.description: Sarah claims she knew nothing of any business issues between John and David and that John was a wonderful man.
clues.name: Sarah's Testimony

clues.description: An old insurance policy on John's life, taken out by Sarah, with a surprisingly large payout.
clues.name: Insurance Policy

clues.description: Robert confirms he saw two figures arguing outside the home that evening, though he couldn't see who it was.
clues.name: Robert's Testimony

clues.description: Michael claims John made him revise his will recently to cut David out and add his wife.
clues.name: Michael's Testimony

clues.description: The official last will and testament, confirming David has been removed and the primary benefactor is Sarah.
clues.name: The Will

clues.description: A CCTV image from the Art Gallery confirming that Arthur and Charlotte were at the gallery.
clues.name: CCTV image

clues.description: A broken vase near the victim's body, shards of glass scattered around. There are traces of a unique pigment inside the damage mark in the wall, a pigment used in Charlotte's recent work.
clues.name: Broken Vase

clues.description: A palette in Charlotte's studio with a unique pigment matching the trace found on the broken vase.
clues.name: Palette with Pigment

clues.description: A drawing of John Smith with a dagger through the heart.
clues.name: sketchbook drawing

clues.description: Security footage from The Drunken Palette confirming Emily was present all evening.
clues.name: Bar Security Footage

clues.description: A bar tab for Emily Carter showing multiple strong drinks purchased throughout the evening.
clues.name: Bar Tab

clues.description: Photos from an auction that Michael Hudson attended. He can clearly be seeing in the photos.
clues.name: Auction Photos

locations.description: A luxurious study filled with valuable artwork and first edition books. A large mahogany desk sits in the center of the room.
locations.name: John's House

locations.description: Messy creative space, filled with brushes, paints and half-finished sculptures.
locations.name: Charlotte's Studio

locations.description: Dark and divey, the frequent hang-out spot for local artists.
locations.name: The Drunken Palette

locations.description: Slightly cluttered but stylish apartment, filled with books and art.
locations.name: Arthur's Apartment

locations.description: A large, dimly lit warehouse where John stored much of his collection. It's filled with crates and shrouded in shadows.
locations.name: Art Warehouse

mystery.description: John Smith, a wealthy art collector and gallery owner, has been found murdered in his study. The prime suspects are those closest to him, each with their own motive.
mystery.title: The Art of Deception

solution.method: Charlotte was envious of John's success and fame. Using her knowledge of his collection and access to his home – through Emily, whom she coerced by preying on her insecurities – she broke a vase over his head during an argument, leaving paint traces as a clue.
